constituent: status, tree, wood, each, walking legs, mouth
heisigStory: If you can imagine trees as status symbols (as they might well be for those living in Japan's congested cities, where greenery has become something of a luxury item), then each might be aiming to have his/her own tree, just to keep up with the Suzukis.
koohiiStory1: Ranger! I want you to go check the status of each tree. "Errr, Each tree sir?" replies the ranger looking out over the vast forest. "That´s Right, I want the status of each tree! Move out!".
koohiiStory2: A man measures his own status by the size of his woody...and compares it to each one he sees.
myStory: trạng thái. mỗi cái cây có một trạng thái khác nhau.
readingExamples: 格式 (かくしき), 規格 (きかく), 性格 (せいかく)
